verses.text: Woe to thee that layest waste, and thou \add wast\add* not laid waste; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to lay waste, thou shalt be wasted; \add and\add* when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.
O LORD, be gracious to us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.
At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.
And your spoil shall be gathered \add like\add* the gathering of the caterpillar: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.
The LORD is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.
And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, \add and\add* strength of salvation: the fear of the LORD \add is\add* his treasure.
Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the embassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
The highways lie waste, the way-faring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.
The earth mourneth \add and\add* languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed \add and\add* hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off \add their fruits\add* .
Now will I rise, saith the LORD; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.
Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, \add as\add* fire, shall devour you.
And the people shall be \add as\add* the burnings of lime: \add as\add* thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.
Ye \add that are\add* far off, hear what I have done; and ye \add that are\add* near, acknowledge my might.
The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?

He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;
He shall dwell on high: his place of defense \add shall be\add* the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters \add shall be\add* sure.
Thy eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.
Thy heart shall meditate terror. Where \add is\add* the scribe? where \add is\add* the receiver? where \add is\add* he that counted the towers?
Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, \add that thou canst\add* not understand.

Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thy eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle \add that\add* shall not be taken down; not one of its stakes shall ever be removed, neither shall any of its cords be broken.
But there the glorious LORD \add will be\add* to us a place of broad rivers \add and\add* streams; in which shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass through it.
For the LORD \add is\add* our judge, the LORD \add is\add* our lawgiver, the LORD \add is\add* our king; he will save us.
Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.
And the inhabitants shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein \add shall be\add* forgiven \add their\add* iniquity.
